alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Bayfield; Iron (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 8:51AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A LINE OF HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT CENTRAL BAYFIELD...EAST CENTRAL DOUGLAS...NORTHWESTERN IRON AND WEST CENTRAL ASHLAND COUNTIES... At 850 AM CDT, a line of heavy snow showers was along a line extending from near Ashland, to near Benoit, to near Iron River, to near Brule, and moving east at 35 mph. Visibilities of 1/4 mile or less, wind gusts up to 30 mph, and rapid snow accumulation on roads are expected with this line of heavy snow showers. This line of heavy snow showers will be near... Ashland and Barksdale around 855 AM CDT. Odanah around 900 AM CDT. Benoit around 910 AM CDT. Saxon around 915 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this line of heavy snow showers include Bad River Reservation, Blueberry, New Odanah, Moquah, Cedar, Franks Field and Birch Hill. Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter of a mile in this line of heavy snow showers. Be prepared for changing visibility and road conditions. Reduce your speed and allow more space between you and the vehicle in front of you.
